eventDescription: The first meeting of Samaj was held at the premises of Manji Arjan and Company where Mr. Karsanbhai Devraj Vekaria of gaam Baladia was appointed as the First Chairman. The main objective of this meeting was to build a community (Samaj) building in Mombasa, Kenya and raise funds for the same.
First meeting was convened to deliberate on the Rules and regulation of the Samaj.
The foundation stone laying ceremony of Mombasa Samaj conducted.
Opening ceremony for Mombasa Samaj.
Proposal to construct a building for Nairobi Samaj was put forward by Mr. Ramjibhai Kunverji of gaam Baladia.
Approval for construction of Nairobi Samaj Building was given.
Approval for purchase of Land to construct Nairobi Samaj was given.
Purchase of Land on Ronald Ngala Street in Nairobi for construction of Nairobi Samaj at a value of Kenya Shillings 180,000.00.
Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj, Nairobi was officially registered as per the laws of Kenya.
On the auspicious day of Ramnavmi the Foundation Stone laying Ceremony for Nairobi Samaj building was conducted by Mr. Nanjibhai Harji Varsani of gaam Manukva.
Commencement of construction for the building of Nairobi Samaj.
Inauguration of the Nairobi Samaj building.

eventItems.item: The inauguration of the Main Entrance was carried out by Mr. Khimjibhai Ramji and Mr. Bhimjibhai Ramji of Gaam Baladia.
The inauguration of the Main Hall was carried out by Mr. Ramjibhai Kunverji of gaam Baladia.
The Guest House was inaugurated by Mr. Laljibhai Harji Varsani in Memory of Mr. Nanjibhai Harji Varsani of gaam Manukva.

eventDescription: Permission to place the portrait of Mr. Nanji Harji Varsani in the Main Hall.
First meeting to address and possibly mitigate matrimonial disputes.
Swayamsevak Dal was formed.
Library was inaugurated and opened.
Approval to start a nursery school at Nairobi Samaj.
Approval to open the first bank account for Nairobi Samaj with The Standard Bank of South Africa.
Proposal to abolish child marriages in the community.
Proposal and deliberation on how to raise the education level within the community.
Fund raising for the relief of devastation caused by the disastrous Earthquake in Kutch.
Approval for acquisition of land parcel for construction of a school.
First open social gathering of community members.
Inauguration of extension of the existing Samaj building.
Discussion on establishment of Shree Kutch Leva Patel Samaj Boarding in Bhuj, Kutch.
Appointment of Patel, Shah and Joshi auditors as the first auditors of the Nairobi Samaj.
Large amount of cash and precious ornaments were collected as funds by the community members to support India against the Chinese invasion.
Approval for providing interest free loans to community members for higher education.
Events to honor students who have excelled in their higher education began.
The first constitution booklet of the Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj Nairobi was issued.
A special discussion was held by the Nairobi Samaj regarding the establishment of Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj in Bhuj, Kutch.
The constitution of SCLP Samaj - Bhuj was approved.
Election by voting in Nairobi Samaj was held for the first time for the post of Vice-Chairman.
The 15th anniversary of Nairobi Samaj was celebrated, and a souvenir released.
Additional funds raised for Mombasa Samaj.
Fundraising by bidding was held at Nairobi Samaj for inauguration ceremony of the Bhuj Samaj.

eventItems.item: Inauguration of main building by Mr. Mavjibhai Ruda Varsani
Inauguration of the upper floor by Mr. Devshibhai Dhanji Vekaria
Inauguration of the meeting room by Mr. Veljibhai Karsan
Foundation stone laying of Kanya High School by Mr. Harjibhai Ladha

eventDescription: Approval was given to place the portrait of Mr. Devshibhai Dhanji Vekaria in the Samaj Main Hall.
Mahila Mandal Nairobi was Formed.
The first Diwali Samelan was held at Nairobi Samaj.
The 25th anniversary of Nairobi Samaj was celebrated, and a souvenir released.

On the visit to Kenya by The Prime Minister of India, Mrs. Indira Gandhi, she applauded the service of our civilian community ladies during the war with Pakistan was applauded during a courtesy visit to her by a delegation of Nairobi Samaj leaders and elders.
The Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj "World Conference" was held at Bhuj Samaj.
Funds were collected to help the affected community members during political tension in Kenya.
Funds were raised for the Girls Hostel of Pangani Girls Secondary School.
Approval for the purchase of 6.75 acres of land in Nairobi West for a new Samaj complex.
Approval for the construction of the Samaj Nairobi West Complex.

eventItems.item: The main foundation stone laying ceremony was done by Mr. Ratnabhai Karsan Raghwani's family.
The school foundation stone laying ceremony was done by Mr. Ramjibhai Govind Halai & Sons.
The staff quarters foundation stone laying ceremony of the Samaj was done by Mr. Devshibhai Kunvarji Garara's family.
The Samaj main hall was to be named 'Shri Devshibhai Dhanji Memorial Hall.
The kitchen hall was to be named after Mr. Kunvarji Devraj Varsani & Sons.
The health center was to be named after Mr. Gopal Shivji Jadva Hirani family.

eventDescription: An additional seven and a half acres of land adjacent to the Samaj land was acquired.
Samaj Youth League was formed.
Religious Havan ceremony for new Samaj complex was held.
A decision was made regarding renting of the old Samaj Building.
Inauguration of the new Nairobi West Samaj complex.
The Board of Governors (B.O.G) was formed for the management of Samaj School.

eventItems.item: Approval for rules and regulations for the management of Samaj School

eventDescription: Agreed to place the Murtis of The Gods on the stage of Samaj hall.
Approval of rules and regulations of Samaj Medical Relief Scheme (M.R.S).
Inauguration of the Samaj School.
5 acres of land acquired next to the Samaj Nairobi West complex.
The Samaj in conjunction with Hindu Council of Kenya, raised funds for drought relief in Kenya.
A decision was taken regarding the sale of the old Samaj building on Ronald Ngala Street.
The first Samooh Lagnotsav (mass marriage) was held at Nairobi Samaj with 18 couples.
The School at Nairobi West was named Shree L. R. Pindolia Academy.
Sale of the Samaj Building on Ronald Ngala Street.
It was decided that proceeds from the sale of the samaj building on Ronald Ngala Street would be used to build housing for the Community members.
The Medical Relief Scheme (MRS) was started.
A tree planting program was held in the Samaj compound.
The Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Charitable Trust was formed, and trustees appointed.
Warren Enterprises Ltd. and H. Young (EA) donated a tower water tank to Samaj.
A decision was made to transfer the medical and bursary funds to Samaj Charitable Trust.
Foundation stone laying of Samaj Flat Phase-I was held.

eventItems.item: Mr. Shantilal Velji Bhanderi for Block No. A
Mr. Laljibhai Ratna Raghwani for Block No. B
Laxmanbhai Construction Co. for Block No. C

eventDescription: The construction of the canteen and library was completed.
The work on the Samaj cricket ground was completed, and the Samaj Team was named the Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj Cricket Team.
It was decided that the Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Charitable Trust will undertake the management of the Samaj School.
The average price of Phase I flats in Nairobi West was set at 1,025,000/- for a two-bedroom and 1,225,000/- for a three-bedroom.
The inauguration of Samaj Flats Phase I.
Foundation stone laying ceremony of Samaj Flats Phase-II was performed by respective donors.

eventItems.item: Mr. Kalyanbhai Naran Kerai for Block No-D in memory of his mother Late Lalbai Naran Kerai.
Mr. Karsanbhai Lalji Vekaria and Mrs. Kesarben Karsan Vekaria for Block No-E.
Mr. Ramjibhai Keshra Varsani for Block No-F.

eventDescription: Inauguration of the swimming pool, donated by the Laxmanbhai Group and named 'Raghwani Pool'.
The construction of Samaj Flats Phase-II was completed.
Foundation stone laying of Samaj Medical Clinic building.
Approval for the construction of the volleyball ground.
Foundation stone laying ceremony of the Samaj Nursery School was done by donors Mr. Karsanbhai Lalji Vekaria and Mrs. Kesarbai Karsan Vekaria.
Approved the Samaj Charitable Trust to send Kenya Shillings 1 Crore to Bhuj Samaj for Kutch earthquake relief.
Approval was granted for placing 40 billboards for advertisement on the Samaj cricket ground.
The Samaj Clinic building was inaugurated, in honor of Mr. Kurjibhai Vishram Vekaria.
The construction of Samaj Secondary School building was completed and named R. R. Varsani Secondary Section.
The work of building gabions on banks on both sides of the river passing through the samaj compound was completed.
Second round of Kutch Earthquake Relief of Kenya Shillings 80 lakhs was sent to the Bhuj Samaj, bringing the total amount sent to Kenya Shillings 1 crore 80 lakhs.
The Constitution of the School Board of Governors and Samaj Charitable Trust was amended.
The Samaj celebrated its 50th anniversary and the 10th anniversary of the new complex in Nairobi West during Easter holidays and a souvenir published.
The inauguration of Samaj Nursery School held during the Samaj Golden Jubilee celebration and the Nursery was named Smt. Amarbai Devshi Dhanji Nursery School.
The completion of Samaj volleyball ground with shed.
First free medical camp held by Samaj.
Approval to purchase a 10-acre plot in Langata.
Information was received that the Ruparel family will donate the land with a tennis court to Samaj.
The Samaj Charitable Trust organized three camps for drought relief during which food packets were distributed in affected areas of Kenya.
A decision was made regarding the sale of the Samaj flats Phase-III.
Inaugural Samaj's Six â€“ A-Side Cricket tournament.
In the post-election riots, the community members from Kisumu who came to Nairobi were provided with full assistance by Nairobi Samaj.
Decision given to obtain the public utility land in Langata to construct Langata Samaj School Campus.

The foundation stone laying Samaj cricket ground pavilion was conducted by Mr. Ravjibhai Govind Varsani and Shri Abjibapa's Chhatri and Hanumanji Mandir Trust, and the pavilion was named KAY Pavilion.
The public utility plot in Langata was officially registered in the name of the Samaj.
A decision was made to build residences on 10 acres of the Samaj plot in Langata.
The average price for flats to be built on the Samaj plot in Langata was set at 6,500,000/- for a three-bedroom flat and 5,200,000/- for a two-bedroom flat.
The residential project in Langata commenced, comprising of 356 flats, with 256 flats to be sold and 100 flats to be rented.
Samaj Karibu Rapid Response (KRR) was formed.
Approval for construction of a school in Langata.
Langata Samaj housing project completed.
A proposal made for the construction of a hospital by Samaj.
The Samaj Cutchi Economic Council (CEC) was formed.

The initiation of organizing a liaison meeting with 24 village elders, their committee members, Donors to Samaj, the Samaj Managing Committee, Samaj Charitable Trust Trustees, Samaj Trustees and Samaj Sub Committees.
Construction of Langata Samaj School began.
A decision was made regarding the purchase of land for building a hospital.
The Langata School was named Mama R. D. Varsani, and the auditorium named in honor of Mr. Meghjibhai Ratna Pindoria.
An outdoor open gym was started at the Samaj Nairobi West complex.
Samaj partook in welcoming The Prime Minister of India, Hon. Narendrabhai Modi to Kenya at Kasarani Stadium.
A decision was made to place the portrait of Mr. Ramji Ratna Varsani in the main hall of the Samaj in Nairobi West.

The 25th anniversary of the Nairobi West Samaj complex was celebrated as 'T25'. Public benefiting projects were organized, and the Prime Minister of India, Hon. Narendrabhai Modi addressed the community via video conference. A commemorative souvenir and documentary was released.
The Samaj was honored with the 'Hindu Ratna Award' by the Hindu Council of Kenya for outstanding educational work by the Samaj School.
A new survey report of the Nairobi Samaj premises was received.
Higher Education Loan program (HELC) was restarted.
Accommodation facility for students from outside Nairobi coming for higher studies was started.
During the 25th Samooh Lagnotsav (mass marriage) a fundraising event under the Samaj Charitable Trust was held to support the provision of borewells and latrines in needy areas of Kenya.

Due to COVID-19, many activities and Samaj school was closed, an online education system was set up for remote / home studies for students. Four Covid 19 vaccination camps were held. 25,000 food bags were distributed to needy areas through the Nairobi Samaj and three Nairobi Temples (East Africa Satang Swaminarayan Temple, Shree Kutch Satsang Swaminarayan Temple and Shree Swaminarayan Siddhant Sajivan Temple).
Construction of the Langata Samaj School Auditorium was commenced.
Approval was given to purchase a 5-acre plot in Langata for the Samaj Hospital and elders of the Nairobi Samaj pledged to assist in purchasing of this property.
The installation of flood light towers to facilitate day-night cricket at the Samaj cricket ground was completed.
From funds raised during the 25th mass marriage ceremony, seven boreholes with pumps for water facility were installed in needy areas of the country.
Approval granted for the construction of a parking silo in the multipurpose ground.
Approval for construction of staff quarters for Samaj staff on Samaj Nairobi West premises.
The work on the Langata Samaj School Auditorium was completed.
Approval given for acquiring land for the Samaj Hospital with Tranquility Company.
Decision made by managing committee for scanning of old documents of the Samaj to create a comprehensive archive catalogue.
Construction of an administration block for the Samaj and School commenced.
Construction of the Samaj staff quarters was completed.
Commencement of construction for new parking block in Samaj.
